content: Could be possible to have a stream dedicated to it? We (@gnzlbg and me) asked for it before but I guess the request got lost ^^;
@centril in the mean time, the discussions keep going in private chats
I really do believe the discussions should be in the open somewhere
literally anywhere would be better than private chats
any chance you could link to request? my brief attempt to search for "stdarch" didn't yield anything apart from this topic.
Can we have t-libs/stdarch created?
@pnkfelix it was back in the time it was stdsimd ^^;
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/122653-zulip/topic/stream.20for.20stdsimd
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/122653-zulip/topic/stream.20for.20stdsimd
ah :D
let me see if I can get in touch with someone in wg-meta to make sure I know the policy here
I personally would have no problem with creating a stream at this point, but I just want to make sure there isn't some more structured protocol one is supposed to go through first.
It would be helpful if they would document what the process is. We essentially just write that here, ping a couple of Zulip admins, which often say the same thing you do, and... then nothing happens.
I don't know if one can pin stuff in Zulip, but maybe just saying that one should open an issue somewhere about this would be helpful.
Yeah I understand, I basically just asked that question, about what the process is, if any
Thanks
Okay @davidtwco said he has tended to just do it whenever someone asks.
So let me try to do the same for you
@gnzlbg I'll PM you some Questions, okay?
sure
thank you again for replying so quickly
Okay I think this is what you want: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/208962-t-libs.2Fstdarch/topic/test.20linkifier/near/175794374
I didn't know if this had its own working-group or not, analogous to t-libs/wg-allocators
if it does, it might be good to rename it now to t-libs/wg-stdarch, before any content is added.
I'll wait for @gnzlbg to tell before using it then :)
@Luca Barbato well, do you know if there is a working group?
That I know there isn't, but...
Actually... do you know what is the process of starting a working group? ^^;
Ah, actually, lets not worry about this question! Apparently Zulip supports alpha-renaming

Actually... do you know what is the process of starting a working group? ^^;

For this, I do think there is a documented process
That's good :)
Okay here the the documentation for forming a new working group

but note that this is the documentation for T-compiler. Someone pointed out to me when I was asking the protocol for creating new streams that while the compiler team is working out its own protocols, it isn't necessary what the rest of the teams on the Rust project will adopt.
Thank you :)
